    Richard Eckart de Castilho

    • Constructor Detail

      • SSpaceVectorReader

        public SSpaceVectorReader(edu.ucla.sspace.common.SemanticSpace aSSpace)
        Create a vector source for an existing semantic space. To build such a space, you best use the LsiIndexWriter from DKPro IR.

      • SSpaceVectorReader

        public SSpaceVectorReader(java.io.File aDirectory)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new semantic space from scratch based on all "txt" documents in the specified path. If you want to have full control over the tokenization, normalization, stop word removal and such, you should build the semantic space yourself and then use the other constructor.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        See Also:
        #createSemanticSpace}

      • createSemanticSpace

        public static edu.ucla.sspace.common.SemanticSpace createSemanticSpace(java.io.File aInputDir,
                                                       int aMaxDimensions)
                                                                throws java.io.IOException
        Create a LSA space from all "txt" files in the specified directory.
        Parameters:
        aInputDir - directory containing the input files.
        aMaxDimensions - maximum number of dimensions. If 0 or negative, 300 is used, which has been determined as a good default for LSA models. If the directory contains less than 300 documents, the number of documents is used as the number of dimensions.
        Returns:
        a semantic space.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
